_comment: Master users. When they'll execute a command through Discord's Chat, not any verification about permissions will be done. They'll also be able to do .execute-admin to execute commands like it was executed in the terminal.
The default image shown when someone is banned. Can be null
Where the errors should be logged in chat, can be null.
Can be roles ids or users ids.
The database file (relative to the root of the project)
Database encryption password. Requires @journeyapps/sqlcipher (npm install @journeyapps/sqlcipher). Leave null for no encryption.
Database performance optimizations. Enable based on your hosting situation.

database.pragmas._comment: WAL mode improves concurrent read/write performance
Performance mode enables: synchronous=NORMAL, temp_store=MEMORY, 64MB cache, 256MB mmap
Custom cache size in KB (use negative numbers, e.g., -64000 for 64MB)
Store temporary tables in memory instead of disk

_comment: The bot will only react, send message, execute commands in this guild if this is a guild-id
Message sent when someone talks with the bot in DM
Replied to a user who didn't have the permissions to execute a command
chat.insufficient-permissions: :negative_squared_cross_mark: ${author} You don't have enough permissions to execute this command
_comment: The number of warnings before a ban (when spamming)
Number of experience given per msg
Object describing presence (https://discord.js.org/docs/packages/discord.js/14.24.2/ClientPresence). JSON not supported.
